oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Drawing of "A General View of Our Works and the Rebel Camp Before Chattanooga"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Drawing done in Chattanooga by Pvt. James Long, Co. E, 5th Ky. Cav., USA. Artist inscribes "J.Long 1863" in lower right hand corner. Long enlisted March 31, 1862 in Burkesville, Kentucky. He provided his own horse and horse equipments when he enlisted. Records indicate that Long was captured near Chattanooga on Oct. 2, 1863 but some of his letters provide contradictory information. He was paroled and exchanged Nov. 20, 1864 and mustered out on March 31, 1865 near Columbus, Ohio.
